Complete reference for all webforest functions, organized by category.

## Core Functions

The main entry points for creating visualizations. `forest_plot()` is the primary function for most use cases.

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [`forest_plot()`](forest_plot.qmd) | Create interactive forest plots |
| [`webtable()`](webtable.qmd) | Create table-only widgets (no forest plot) |
| [`split_forest()`](split_forest.qmd) | Create split forest with sidebar navigation |
| [`save_plot()`](save_plot.qmd) | Export to SVG, PNG, or PDF |
| [`save_split_forest()`](save_plot.qmd#save_split_forest) | Export split forest to directory |

## Styling Functions

Style your plots using the fluent API. These functions work on both `forest_plot()` widgets and `WebSpec` objects.

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [`set_row_style()`](styling.qmd#set_row_style) | Apply row-level styling (bold, italic, color, type, indent) |
| [`set_marker_style()`](styling.qmd#set_marker_style) | Style interval markers (color, shape, opacity, size) |
| [`set_column_style()`](styling.qmd#set_column_style) | Apply per-cell styling to specific columns |
| [`set_theme()`](styling.qmd#set_theme) | Apply a theme by name or object |

::: {.callout-tip}
## Constructor Arguments vs Fluent API

Every styling function has equivalent direct arguments in `forest_plot()`:

```r
# These produce identical results:
forest_plot(data, ..., row_bold = "is_summary", marker_color = "dir_color")

forest_plot(data, ...) |>
  set_row_style(bold = "is_summary") |>
  set_marker_style(color = "dir_color")
```

Use direct arguments when configuration is known upfront. Use the fluent API when styling depends on computation or you need multiple variants.
:::

## Advanced: Specification Objects

For advanced use cases requiring programmatic plot construction, you can work with specification objects directly. Most users should use `forest_plot()` with direct arguments instead.

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [`web_spec()`](web_spec.qmd#web_spec) | Create plot specification programmatically |
| [`web_group()`](web_spec.qmd#web_group) | Define row group |
| [`web_effect()`](web_spec.qmd#web_effect) | Define effect for multi-effect plots |
| [`web_interaction()`](web_spec.qmd#web_interaction) | Configure interaction settings |
| [`web_interaction_minimal()`](web_spec.qmd#web_interaction) | Minimal interactivity preset |
| [`web_interaction_publication()`](web_spec.qmd#web_interaction) | Publication mode preset |
